thread.title: Saudi prince sends $1bn message on Twitter
thread.title_full: Saudi prince sends $1bn message on Twitter

title: Saudi prince sends $1bn message on Twitter
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Saudi prince sends $1bn message on Twitter The prince’s share purchases appear to indicate his support for the new chief executive Chris Ratcliffe/Getty Images Google+ 1 of 1 The prince’s share purchases appear to indicate his support for the new chief executive Chris Ratcliffe/Getty Images James Dean Technology Correspondent Published 1 minute ago 
Saudi Arabia’s richest man has become the second-largest investor in Twitter after he amassed shares worth a billion dollars. 
Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, a nephew of King Salman, and Kingdom Holding, his investment vehicle, said yesterday that their combined stake in the microblogging site had risen past 5 per cent. The news sent Twitter shares more than 5 per cent higher, up $1.42 at $29.04, in afternoon trading in New York. 
The prince’s share purchases appear to indicate his support for Jack Dorsey, who was named as Twitter’s permanent chief executive this week. Mr Dorsey, a co-founder of the social Subscribe now
